apps.linear.simulation
Class Register

java.lang.Object
  apps.linear.simulation.Register

 class Register
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a registration window at which students will queue up for registration.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

Field Summary
(package private)  boolean busy
          Busy flag to tell if a student is currently at this registration window.
(package private)  int clock
          Registration clock that starts ticking when a student steps up to this window to register, and stops ticking (reset to zero) when registration of the student is completed.
(package private)  int duration
          Number of time intervals needed to register a student.
 
Constructor Summary
Register(int timePerStudent)
          Initializes a new instance with time taken to register a student.
 
Method Summary
(package private)  int getClock()
          Returns the status of the clock, i.e.
(package private)  boolean isFree()
          Tells whether this window is free, i.e.
(package private)  void startUp()
          Starts up the registration process for a student, i.e.
(package private)  void stepTime()
          Steps up the time to the next interval.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

duration

int duration
Number of time intervals needed to register a student.

clock

int clock
Registration clock that starts ticking when a student steps up to this window to register, and stops ticking (reset to zero) when registration of the student is completed.

busy

boolean busy
Busy flag to tell if a student is currently at this registration window.

Constructor Detail

Register

Register(int timePerStudent)
Initializes a new instance with time taken to register a student.

Parameters:
timePerStudent - Time taken to register a student.
Method Detail

startUp

void startUp()
Starts up the registration process for a student, i.e. students steps up to this window. Sets the clock to zero and busy indicator to true.

stepTime

void stepTime()
Steps up the time to the next interval. If the new time is equal to the duration of registration, the clock is reset to zero and the busy indicator is set to false, i.e. the window is free.

isFree

boolean isFree()
Tells whether this window is free, i.e. available for registering the next student.

Returns:
True if window is free, false otherwise.

getClock

int getClock()
Returns the status of the clock, i.e. number of time intervals that have elapsed since the current registration started.

Returns:
Time elapsed since current registration started, zero if window if free.
